FuncDef:
The oam-bind ingress bfd-session command enables unidirectional fault transmission from a BFD session to an interface.
The undo oam-bind ingress bfd-session command disables unidirectional fault transmission from a BFD session to an interface. The oam-bind ingress bfd-session command enables unidirectional fault transmission from a BFD session to an interface. The undo oam-bind ingress bfd-session command disables unidirectional fault transmission from a BFD session to an interface. By default, fault transmission from a BFD session to an interface is disabled.
CLIs: undo oam-bind ingress bfd-session { <bfd-session-id> | session-name <bfd-session-name> } triggerif-downegressinterface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies·the·BFD·session·name.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Configures the associated interface to go down.
-

Specifies the interface associated with downstream traffic.
-

Specifies the name, type, and ID of an interface.
-

Specifies the session for upstream transmission.
-

Specifies the local discriminator of a BFD session.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16384.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-oam-mgr] oam-bind ingress bfd-session 1 trigger if-down egress interface 100GE 1/0/1
ExtraInfo: Configure unidirectional fault transmission from a BFD session to an interface. When detecting a link fault, the BFD session on the local device notifies the associated interface and triggers the interface to go down. When the faulty link recovers, the BFD session on the local device notifies the associated interface and t riggers the interface to go up.
